snippet: The assertion by Ansar Beit al-Maqdis signaled an ominous turn in a battle militants have waged against the government since the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi.
abstract: Egyptian militant group Ansar Beit al-Maqdis claims responsibility for the bombing of a tourist bus in Sinai Peninsula that killed three South Korean citizens and an Egyptian bus driver; group has carried out months of deadly assaults on the police and the military.
lead_paragraph: The assertion by Ansar Beit al-Maqdis signaled an ominous turn in a battle militants have waged against the government since the ouster of President Mohamed Morsi.

headline.main: Militant Group Says It Attacked Tourist Bus in Sinai
headline.print_headline: Militant Group Says It Attacked Tourists in Sinai
